result.execSummary:
The defendant John D. Teweles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Dodge Cty DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant John D. Teweles in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is victim rights compliant.  State heard, stands mute on sentencing recomendations.  2 Character witnesses testified on behalf of defendant.  Atty Mayer heard on sentencing recomendations.  Def makes stmt.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:


$100 + costs
Provide DNA sample

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Status conference on June 9, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial on July 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John D. Teweles in court by phone with attorney Bradley J Jansen in person.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Jansen heard; requests to withdraw as counsel. Defendant heard. Court states this is 3rd attorney leaving case, explains procedure; discussion held. Court heard and allows withdraw of Atty Jansen; states county will not appoint counsel; sets trial out 90 days - will not continue again. Atty Jansen states entire file being dropped off after this hearing at SPD Office for future counsel.  Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Arraignment on November 26, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John D. Teweles in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. prelim waiver reviewed;  Arraignment scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 08:15 am.

(9:25) Defendant, John D. Teweles in court w/o counsel, Intern Greg Holdahl (Robert G. Barrington) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim 10/2/14 at 8:30 in Br. 3 & Review 9/3/14 at 8:15 in Br. 1; Court sets bond at $1,000.00 PA BOND with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.
